root: ^Great job Tempy! You've saved this project!
^Now I'll be able to release that level to my supporters, and the money will keep coming in!
^Well, it was stressful, but at least we're safe now!
^Yep! Just as long as you keep up the good work!
^What do you mean? I thought this was a one-time issue!
^Well, I did mention that I had missed more than one deadline, right? I kinda owe a couple dozen levels to my backers at this point.
^Making that last level in time was a good start, but if we don't hurry up and get caught up on that backlog, I might get kicked off of FundHub.
^Oh, that's the website I use to get money.
^Creators show off the projects they're working on, and then other people who are interested in the projects can support the projects with money.
^In exchange they get stuff like demos and whatever.
^It's cool because I get money for something I was planning on doing anyways!
^It sucks because now I have to hurry up and get stuff done, or else I'm sunk.
^So yeah, to summarize, the time limit is here to stay.
^Hm. I'm not too enthusiastic about the speed constraint, but sounds like there's no way around it.
^So I'll push through! For the fans!
^Glad to hear it! Let's get back to making a game then.
^I'm going to assume by your lack of feedback so far that you loved the last level, and we can move onto making the next one.
^Sure! The last one seemed pretty good.
^Alright, what to do in this one... At this point, I think you've got a pretty good set of abilities, so we should focus on level features.
^And what game is complete without some spikes?
^That's... a little intimidating, but a fair point.
^The enemies have been more adorable than anything, so a real hazard other than pits seems appropriate.
^Cool! Spikes it is! Strap yourself in for something new!
